defendantCaseOffences.title: Occupy reserved seat / berth without a valid ticket on the Tyne and Wear Metro
defendantCaseOffences.legislation: Contrary to byelaw 19 and 31(1) of the Tyne and Wear Metro Byelaws made under sections 58 and 62 of the Tyneside Metropolitan Railway Act 1973.
defendantCaseOffences.displayText:
Community order England / Wales
End Date 27 May 2020
Responsible officer a probation officer
Supervising Court Lavenar
Persistent offender previously fined yes
Judge reserves breach proceedings false
Direction that a failure to comply be dealt with by magistrates' court true
Probation team to be notified Prison
defendantCaseOffences.wording:
Has a violent past and fear that he will commit further offences and
                interfere with witnesse

prompts.label: Direction that a failure to comply be dealt with by magistrates' court

nowText.label: orderText
nowText.value:
The Court has made a Community Order containing the requirements specified in this order. You must have complied with all the requirements by the end date stated. This is the date when the order will stop being in force.  

While this Community Order remains in force, you must

  • keep in touch with your Probation Officer as they tell you
  • tell your Probation Officer if you intend to change your address
  • comply with all requirements included in the order

WARNING

If you do not comply with this order, you will be brought back to court. The Court may then

  • change the order by adding extra requirements
  • pass a different sentence for the original offences, or
  • You could be sent to prison

Note

Either you or your Probation Officer can ask the court to look again at this order and the court can then change it or cancel it if the court feels that is the right thing to do. The court may also pass a different sentence for the original offences. If you wish to ask the court to look at your order again you should get in touch with the court
